list_definition.definition: to be the first person to make or use (eg a machine, method etc)
to make up or think of (eg an excuse or story)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ll have to invent some excuse for not going with him.

list_ex_of_english: The human mind, straining to interpret elusive detail at the limit of perception, invented narrow linear features that are simply not there.
The maps are invented ones, but the majority are detailed enough to resemble the real thing.
One could say that mechanical production set itself in opposition to something, and invented craft - making without machines.
Neither way are pupils being helped to get better at inventing their own music.
In other words, it is not plausible that these individuals should have invented so similar stories at different times and places.
In this view, phages could be considered as a powerful way of inventing new genes potentially beneficial to their hosts.
After all, the laws of war existed in some form long before the idea of the modern multilateral treaty had been invented.
They invented the notion of the "profession" as an occupation done for the salus publica, the public welfare.
